param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT4_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT4_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT4_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT4_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT4_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT4_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT4_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT4_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT4_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT4_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT4_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT4_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT4_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT4_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT4_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT4_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT4_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT4_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT4_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT4_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT4_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT4_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT4_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT4_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT4_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT5_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT5_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT5_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT5_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT5_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT5_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT5_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT5_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT5_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT5_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT5_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT5_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT7_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT7_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT7_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT7_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT7_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT7_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT7_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT7_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT7_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT7_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT7_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT7_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT7_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT7_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT7_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT7_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT7_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT7_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT7_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT7_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT8_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT8_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT8_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT8_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT8_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT8_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT8_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT8_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT8_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT8_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATT8_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT8_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATT8_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT8_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT8_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT8_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT8_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT8_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT8_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT8_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT8_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT8_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT8_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT8_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT8_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATTA_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTA_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTA_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTA_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATTA_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATTA_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATTA_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATTB_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATTB_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATTB_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATTB_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATTB_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATTB_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTB_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTB_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTB_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATTB_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTB_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATTB_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATTB_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATTB_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATTB_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATTB_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTB_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATTB_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATTB_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATTB_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATTB_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATTB_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATTB_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTB_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTB_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATTB_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATTB_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTB_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTB_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTB_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTB_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATTB_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTB_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTB_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTB_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTB_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTE_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATTE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.humanName: ESC Telemetry Index to write to
param.name: BATTE_ESC_INDEX
param.documentation: ESC Telemetry Index to write voltage, current, consumption and temperature data to. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATTE_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATTE_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATTE_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTE_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATTE_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17. For Synthetic Current sensor monitors, this is the maximum, full throttle current draw.

param.name: BATTE_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor for Analog Sensors. For Synthetic Current sensor, this offset is the zero throttle system current and is added to the calculated throttle base current.

param.name: BATTE_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied.

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATTE_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATTE_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATTE_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTE_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATTE_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATTE_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATTE_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATTE_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTE_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTE_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTE_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATTE_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATTE_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATTE_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATTE_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATTE_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATTE_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTE_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATTE_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATTE_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATTE_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATTE_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATTE_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATTF_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATTF_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATTF_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATTF_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATTF_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATTF_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTF_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTF_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTF_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATTF_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTF_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATTF_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATTF_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATTF_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATTF_ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATTF_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

bitmask.bit: MPPT reports input voltage and current
Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node
Battery is for internal autopilot use only
Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average
Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS, 7:Allow DroneCAN InfoAux to be from a different CAN node, 8:Battery is for internal autopilot use only, 9:Sum monitor measures minimum voltage instead of average, 10:Allow DroneCAN dynamic node update on hot-swap

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT_FL_VLT_MIN
param.documentation: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_V_MULT
param.documentation: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

param.name: BATT_FL_FLTR
param.documentation: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

param.name: BATT_FL_PIN
param.documentation: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to.Analog Airspeed or RSSI ports can be used for Analog input( some autopilots provide others also). Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

param.name: BATT_FL_FF
param.documentation: First order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_FS
param.documentation: Second order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_FT
param.documentation: Third order polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_FL_OFF
param.documentation: Offset polynomial fit term

param.name: BATT_MAX_VOLT
param.documentation: Maximum voltage of battery. Provides scaling of current versus voltage

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INS2XX sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT_ESC_MASK
param.documentation: If 0 all connected ESCs will be used. If non-zero, only those selected in will be used.

param.name: BATT_MAX_AMPS
param.documentation: This controls the maximum current the INA239 sensor will work with.

param.name: BATT_SHUNT
param.documentation: This sets the shunt resistor used in the device

param.name: BATT_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address. If this is zero then probe list of supported addresses

param.name: BATT_CHANNEL
param.documentation: INA3221 channel to return data for

param.humanName: Battery Voltage sensing pin on the AD7091R5 Ic
param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for Current monitoring on AD7091R5.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT).

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BTAG_NUM_CYCLES
param.documentation: Number of cycles the battery has been through

param.name: BTAG_ARM_HOURS
param.documentation: Number of hours the battery has been armed

param.name: BTAG_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Battery capacity in mAh

param.name: BTAG_FIRST_USE
param.documentation: First use time in minutes since 1/1/1970

param.name: BTAG_LAST_USE
param.documentation: Last use time in minutes since 1/1/1970

param.name: BTAG_SERIAL
param.documentation: Serial number

param.name: BTAG_CYCLE_MIN
param.documentation: Cycle minimum time. Minimum time that vehicle is armed in minutes for counting a battery cycle

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID2
param.documentation: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID3
param.documentation: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_USE2
param.documentation: Enable or disable the secondary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT2
param.documentation: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN2
param.documentation: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_USE3
param.documentation: Enable or disable the tertiary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT3
param.documentation: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the COMPASS_CUS_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for Compass orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

param.humanName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN3
param.documentation: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: COMPASS_OFFS_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

param.name: COMPASS_DISBLMSK
param.documentation: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: COMPASS_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: COMPASS_AUTO_ROT
param.documentation: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

values.value: use same tolerance to auto rotate 45 deg rotations

param.humanName: Compass device id with 1st order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO1_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 1st order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 2nd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO2_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 2nd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 3rd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO3_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 3rd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.name: COMPASS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE
param.documentation: Scaling factor for first compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE2
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 2nd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE3
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 3rd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the compass

bitmask.bit: Allow missing DroneCAN compasses to be automaticaly replaced (calibration still required)

param.field: 0:CalRequireGPS, 1: Allow missing DroneCAN compasses to be automaticaly replaced (calibration still required)

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID4
param.documentation: Extra 4th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID5
param.documentation: Extra 5th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID6
param.documentation: Extra 6th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID7
param.documentation: Extra 7th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID8
param.documentation: Extra 8th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_ROLL
param.documentation: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_PIT
param.documentation: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_YAW
param.documentation: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EN
param.documentation: This enables per-motor compass corrections

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EXP
param.documentation: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

param.name: DAC1_TYPE
param.documentation: DAC Type

param.name: DAC1_BUS
param.documentation: I2C bus number

param.name: DAC1_ADDR
param.documentation: I2C address

param.name: DAC1_VREF
param.documentation: Voltage reference

param.name: EFI_TYPE
param.documentation: What method of communication is used for EFI #1

param.name: EFI_COEF1
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Slope). This should be calculated from a log at constant fuel usage rate. Plot (ECYL[0].InjT*EFI.Rpm)/600.0 to get the duty_cycle. Measure actual fuel usage in cm^3/min, and set EFI_COEF1 = fuel_usage_cm3permin / duty_cycle

param.name: EFI_COEF2
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Offset). This can be used to correct for a non-zero offset in the fuel consumption calculation of EFI_COEF1

param.name: EFI_FUEL_DENS
param.documentation: Used to calculate fuel consumption

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_EN
param.documentation: Enable EFI throttle linearisation

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF1
param.documentation: First Order Polynomial Coefficient. (=1, if throttle is first order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF2
param.documentation: Second Order Polynomial Coefficient (=0, if throttle is second order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_COEF3
param.documentation: Third Order Polynomial Coefficient. (=0, if throttle is third order polynomial trendline)

param.name: EFI_THRLIN_OFS
param.documentation: Offset for throttle linearization

param.name: GPS_NAVFILTER
param.documentation: Navigation filter engine setting

param.name: GPS_AUTO_SWITCH
param.documentation: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock, 1:UseBest selects the GPS with highest status, if both are equal the GPS with highest satellite count is used 4:Use primary if 3D fix or better, will revert to 'UseBest' behaviour if 3D fix is lost on primary

values.value: Use primary if 3D fix or better

param.name: GPS_SBAS_MODE
param.documentation: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

param.name: GPS_MIN_ELEV
param.documentation: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

param.name: GPS_INJECT_TO
param.documentation: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

param.name: GPS_SBP_LOGMASK
param.documentation: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

param.name: GPS_RAW_DATA
param.documentation: Handles logging raw data; on uBlox chips that support raw data this will log RXM messages into logger; on Septentrio this will log on the equipment's SD card and when set to 2, the autopilot will try to stop logging after disarming and restart after arming

values.value: Only log every five samples (uBlox only)

param.name: GPS_SAVE_CFG
param.documentation: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

param.name: GPS_AUTO_CONFIG
param.documentation: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

values.value: Enable automatic configuration for Serial GPSes only
Enable automatic configuration for DroneCAN as well

param.name: GPS_BLEND_MASK
param.documentation: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2(Blend)

param.name: GPS_DRV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Additional backend specific options

bitmask.bit: Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox
Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF
Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline
Use ellipsoid height instead of AMSL
Override GPS satellite health of L5 band from L1 health
Enable RTCM full parse even for a single channel
Disable automatic full RTCM parsing when RTCM seen on more than one channel

param.field: 0:Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox,1:Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF,2:Use baudrate 115200,3:Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline,4:Use ellipsoid height instead of AMSL, 5:Override GPS satellite health of L5 band from L1 health, 6:Enable RTCM full parse even for a single channel, 7:Disable automatic full RTCM parsing when RTCM seen on more than one channel

param.name: GPS_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This GPS will be used when GPS_AUTO_SWITCH is 0 and used preferentially with GPS_AUTO_SWITCH = 4.

param.name: GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: GPS type of 1st GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_TYPE

param.name: GPS_TYPE2
param.documentation: GPS type of 2nd GPS

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured).Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_GNSS_MODE.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE2
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured). Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_GNSS_MODE

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_RATE_MS

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS2
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_RATE_MS

param.name: GPS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_X.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_Y.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_POS_Z.

param.name: GPS_POS2_X
param.documentation: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_X.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_Y.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_POS_Z.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_DELAY_MS.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS2
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_DELAY_MS.

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF and GSOF GPS,Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_COM_PORT.

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT2
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF and GSOF GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS1_COM_PORT.

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID1

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID2
param.documentation: GPS Node id for second-discovered GPS.Renamed in 4.6 and later to GPS2_CAN_NODEID.

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: INS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.documentation: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_FAST_SAMPLE
param.documentation: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

param.name: INS_ENABLE_MASK
param.documentation: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

param.humanName: Gyro rate for IMUs with Fast Sampling enabled
param.name: INS_GYRO_RATE
param.documentation: Gyro rate for IMUs with fast sampling enabled. The gyro rate is the sample rate at which the IMU filters operate and needs to be at least double the maximum filter frequency. If the sensor does not support the selected rate the next highest supported rate will be used. For IMUs which do not support fast sampling this setting is ignored and the default gyro rate of 1Khz is used.

param.name: INS_TCAL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting of the Persist bits will save the temperature and/or accelerometer calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

param.name: INS_RAW_LOG_OPT
param.documentation: Raw logging options bitmask
param.field: 0:Log primary gyro only, 1:Log all gyros, 2:Post filter, 3: Pre and post filter

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS5_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.name: INS5_ACC_ID
param.documentation: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS5_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS5_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS5_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS5_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS5_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS5_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS5_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS5_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS5_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.
